### Highlight

In my research, I work towards having easy-to-use software that can be useful to scientists in my field as well as in others. Below is a list of tutorials for packages I developed in parallel with some of my projects.

[**BayesANT - BAYESiAn Nonparametric Taxonomic classifier**]{.orange}

[BayesANT is a DNA barcoding algorithm to classify DNA sequences within a hierarchical taxonomy, while allowing novel species to be discovered in the test set. See [Zito, Rigon, Dunson (2023) MEE.](https://doi.org/10.1080/01621459.2022.2060835)]{style="font-size: 80%;"}

[GitHub](https://github.com/alessandrozito/BayesANT){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn role="button" data-toggle="tooltip" title="bayesant_github"} [Tutorial](https://alessandrozito.github.io/BayesANT/vignette.html){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn role="button" data-toggle="tooltip" title="bayesant_tutorial"}
:::
:::

[BNPvegan - Bayesian nonparametric methods for ecologists]{.forestgreen}

[BNPvegan is an R-package that implements the methods described in [Zito, Rigon, Ovaskainen and Dunson (2023) JASA](https://doi.org/10.1111/2041-210X.14009)]{style="font-size: 80%;"}

[ConjugateDP - random number generator for the Stirling-gamma distribution]{.blue}

[ConjugateDP is an R-package that implements the random sampler for the Stirling-gamma distribution, which is the conjugate prior for the Dirichlet process precision parameter. See methods described in [Zito, Rigon, Dunson (2024+) arXiv](https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.02360)]{style="font-size: 80%;"}

[GitHub](https://github.com/alessandrozito/ConjugateDP){.btn .btn-outline-primary .btn role="button" data-toggle="tooltip" title="ConjugateDP_github"}

</div>
:::
